sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April 1, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von der U.-E. recomm.: der Umbruch! This entry refers to Johannes Brahms: Oktaven und Quinten u. a., ed. Heinrich Schenker (Vienna: Universal Edition, 1933).

Von Bamberger (K. aus Monte Carlo!): bittet HändelConcerto grosso in a-Moll, op. 6, No. 4 (HWV 322) vorzubereiten. From a diary entry of March 17, 1933, it is clear that Bamberger is asking Schenker for his arrangement of Handel‘s Concerto grosso in A minor, Op. 6, No. 4 (HWV 322).
An den Drei Masken Verlag (K.): Abrechnung?
Wege.

Nach dem Abendessen setze ich die Lese fort – nachts schreibt Lie-Liechen die Urschrift. This entry refers to Heinrich Schenker, Erinnerungen an Brahms, Deutsche Zeitschrift, 46. Jahrgang des Kunstwarts, Heft 8 (May 1933), pp. 475–82.
From UE, by registered mail: the page-proofs!
From Bamberger (postcard from Monte Carlo!): requests HandelConcerto grosso in A minor, Op. 6, No. 4 (HWV 322).
To Drei Masken Verlag (postcard): account?
Errands.
After supper, I continue the reading – at night Lie-Liechen writes the first draft.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April 2, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg:
Deutsch von 5–¾8h: geht in ein Sanatorium; gibt einen guten Rat in der Weisse-Eroica-Angelegenheit; klärt über die Verwendung der Aufsätze für Rinn u. Klein in an-
deren Blätter auf – ich rechtfertige meine Haltung bezüglich der von ihm empfohlenen Vorträge usw. Deutsch leidet beim Anblick des sich verlierenden Deutschtums körperlich! Auch in meinem Falle spiele der Antisemitismus mit – was sicher unrichtig ist. Die Aussprache erregt mich, weil ich auf unbewußten Widerstand stoße wegen völliger Unkenntnis des Inhaltes u. Wertes meiner Leistung.
Mein Körper ist ganz erschüttert.

Abschluss der Lese – Lie-Liechen schreibt bis tief in den Morgen! This entry refers to Heinrich Schenker, Erinnerungen an Brahms, Deutsche Zeitschrift, 46. Jahrgang des Kunstwarts, Heft 8 (May 1933), pp. 475–482.

Deutsch from 5 to 7:45: he is going into hospital; offers good advice on the matter concerning Weisse and the "Eroica"; he sheds light on the use of my articles for Rinn and Klein in
other periodicals – I justify my stance with respect to the lectures, etc., that he recommended. Deutsch is physically suffering from his perception of a loss of Germanness! In my case, too, he says that anti-Semitism is playing a role – which is surely not correct. The conversation upsets me, as I encounter unconscious opposition on account of complete ignorance of the content and value of my achievement.
My body is completely shattered.
Conclusion of the reading – Lie-Liechen writes until deep into the morning!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April 3, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Rinn (Br.): erwartet den Aufsatz zwischen dem 5.–10. April.
½11–½12h Postweg: Saphir; in der Bank begleiche ich die Schuld.
Lie-Liechen wird nachts mit der Reinschrift fertig. This entry refers to Heinrich Schenker, Erinnerungen an Brahms, Deutsche Zeitschrift, 46. Jahrgang des Kunstwarts, Heft 8 (May 1933), pp. 475–482.
From Rinn (letter): he expects the article between the 5th and 10th of April.
From 10:30 to 11:30, trip to the post office: Saphir; at the bank, I clear my debt.
Lie-Liechen finishes the fair copy at night.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April 4, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Oppel (Br.): Leiter einer national-sozialistischen „Zelle“, ist beglückt über das 3. Reich! Gegen Reger. Hofft, mich in den Bergen besuchen zu können!

Bamberger gegen 1h: übernimmt von Lie-Liechen die Händel-Bearbeitung. From a diary entry of March 17, 1933, it is clear that Bamberger is referring to Schenker’s arrangement of Handel‘s Concerto grosso in A minor, Op. 6, No. 4 (HWV 322). – hält das Packet nicht für vollständig.
An Bamberger (K. express): Aufklärung!

Nach der Jause Wege – Lie-Liechen trägt das Manuscript The manuscript for Schenker’s Erinnerungen an Brahms, which was published in the Deutsche Zeitschrift, 46. Jahrgang des Kunstwarts, Heft 8 (May 1933), pp. 475–482. für Dr. Rinn zur Post (rec.).
Schön‘ Wetter.
Zwei Wochen Erholung!?!
From Oppel (letter): he has been made leader of a National-Socialist "cell", is delighted about the Third Reich! Is anti-Reger. He hopes to be able to visit me in the mountains!
Bamberger towards 1 o’clock: he takes the Handel arrangement from Lie-Liechen – thinks the package is not complete.
To Bamberger (express postcard): explanation!
After teatime, errands – Lie-Liechen takes the manuscript for Dr. Rinn to the post office (registered mail).
Fair weather.
Two weeks’ recuperation!?!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April 5, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: An Oppel (K.): vorläufig Dank u. Gruß, in 14 Tagen komme ich wieder.

An Weisse (Br.): Zustimmung zur photo-litographischen Abnahme der Eroica-Bilder. These are the Urlinie graphs for Beethoven’s "Eroica" Symphony, published in the third volume of The Masterwork in Music (1930). Dank an Frau Hertha für das Bild der Kinder; beglückwünsche zu den Erfolgen; das Seminar hat bis jetzt kein Urlinie-Heft, vielleicht später. Deutschlands Verhältnisse fordern Opfer auch von uns. Furtwängler ??
Nach der Jause Einkäufe in der Stadt (unter dem Druck der angekündigten Preissteigerung): Augenschirm, 2 paar Strümpfe, einen leichten Schlafrock.
To Oppel (postcard): for the time being, thanks and greetings; in fourteen days I shall return.

To Weisse (letter): I agree to the photo-lithographic reproduction of the "Eroica" graphs. Thanks to Hertha for the photograph of the children; I congratulate him on his successes; the Seminar has hitherto produced no folder of Urlinie analyses, perhaps later. Germany’s condition demands sacrifices even from us. Furtwängler ??
After teatime, shopping in the city (under the pressure of the price rises that have been announced): eyeshade, two pairs of stockings, a lightweight bathrobe.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April 6, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Wilhelm (Br.): heiter, geistreich; über die Kinder, seine Lebenshaltung – Witze.
Von Kalmus (K.): wird zwei Abzüge der Vignette schicken u. die kleinen Photographien verehren.
Wege – Waage: 82.90 kg im blauen Anzug.
Von dem Drei Masken Verlag Abrechnung.
From Wilhelm (letter): cheerful, full of wit; about his children, his way of life – jokes.
From Kalmus (postcard): he will send two printouts of the title-page, and make the small photographs a present to me.
Errands – weight: 82.90 kg in my blue suit.
From Drei Masken Verlag, account.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April 7, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Bamberger (Br.): Alles in Ordnung – ladet zu seinem Konzert am „Tage der Musikpflege“ ein. On April 22–23, 1933, the Tag der Musikpflege, encouraged by the conductor Friedrich Dürauer and organized by the music critic Robert, was celebrated at events throughout Austria in which musicians offered their services free of charge. In the capital, concerts were given by the Vienna Philharmonic, singers from the State Opera, and several chamber music societies. At the Opera, free ballet performances were offered to children from poor families (see Paul Stefan, "Ein ‘Tag der Musikpflege’ in Wien," Musikblätter des Anbruch 15, vol. 4/5 (1933), p. 68). At the Palais Kinsky, Carl Bamberger conducted a Bach Brandenburg concerto and a cantata, a harpsichord concerto by Haydn, and a Divertimento in D major by Mozart (probably K. 334, on account of its famous Minuet, which is mentioned by the reviewer: see Kleine Chronik. Kammerkonzert im Palais Kinsky, Neue freie Presse, No. 24648, April 26, 1933, evening edition, p. 2).
An Bamberger An Baumgarten (Br.): ob er zum Thee kommen möchte?
Meine neuen Hemden (drei) werden geliefert.
An „Tag der Musikpflege“ See fn.1 (Br.): bitte zwei Plätze zu reservieren.
From Bamberger (letter): everything is in order – invites us to his concert on the "Day of Music-Making."
To Bamberger To Baumgarten (letter): would he like to come for tea?
My (three) new shirts are sent.
To the "Day of Music-Making" (letter): please reserve two seats.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April 8, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Nach der Jause Wege – kaufen eine weiße Primel.
Ordnung vor Wiederaufnahme des freien Satzes.
After teatime, errands – we buy a white-flowering primrose.
Ordering before resumption of work on Free Composition.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April 9, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Sonntag – nach der Jause ¼6–½7h auf dem Gürtel in Sonne.
Die Kastanien stecken schon die Kerzen Kerzen: the name for the candle-shaped blossoms of the chestnut tree. aus!
Zeige Lie-Liechen Brahms „Auf dem Kirchhofe“ mit großer Freude.

Em. List singt im Rf. According to the radio listings in the Neue freie Presse, Emanuel List sang lieder and arias by Schubert, Rossini, Verdi, Mozart, and Albert Lortzing; he was accompanied by Erich Meller.
Nach langer Zeit eine Zweier-Lege!
Sunday. After teatime, 5:15 to 6:30 along the Gürtel in the sunshine.
The chestnuts are already displaying their candles!
I show Lie-Liechen Brahms’s Auf dem Kirchhofe, with great joy.
Emanuel List sings on the radio.
After a long time, another round of solitaire completed in two rounds!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April 10, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Postweg – ¾ Stunden: an Callwey: S. 8.50.

Von Rinn (Br.): wird die „Erinnerungen“ bringen, erkundigt sich nach dem Haydn-Aufsatz. File 49 in the Oster Collection contains extensive materials for an unfinished article on Haydn, apparently from the 1930s.
Von Weisse (Br.OJ 15/16, [91]): zu Vrieslander u. meine Kritik der Lieder!
Von Baumgarten (Br.): kommt Mittwoch um 6h.
Meine Matraze wird neu überzogen!
Trip to the post office – three quarters of an hour: to Callwey, 8.50 shillings.
From Rinn (letter): he will publish the "Recollections," enquires about the article on Haydn.
From Weisse (letterOJ 15/16, [91]): concerning Vrieslander, and my review of his songs!
From Baumgarten (letter): he will come on Wednesday at 6 o’clock.
My mattress is revived!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April 11, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg:
Furtwängler an den Minister: nimmt Stellung gegen die theo-
retische Aechtung der Juden – für die Kunst läßt er nur gut oder schlecht als Kriterium zu. Furtwängler’s open letter to Joseph Goebbels appeared on April 11, 1933, in the Berliner Tageblatt. The following day the paper published Goebbel’s reply. Liberal- and Social-Democratic-orientated newspapers in foreign countries reported the protest on their front pages: the Neue freie Presse published the article Es gibt nur gute oder schlechte Kunst! Der Appell Furtwänglers. – Konservative Kritik in Deutschland (April 12, 1933, morning edition, pp. 1–2). Furtwängler’s letter is reprinted in Ton und Wort: Aufsätze und Vorträge 1918 bis 1954 (Wiesbaden: Brockhaus, 1954), pp. 70–71.

Furtwängler to the minister: he takes a stand against the
theoretical condemnation of the Jews – where art is concerned, the only criterion is whether it is good or bad.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April 11, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Furtwängler (an den Minister) An Weisse (Br., 6 Seiten): Klarstellung des Mißverständnisses – Humus-Angelegenheit, aber verbesserter Humus soll willkommen geheißen werden.
An Frau Komorn (Visitenk.): das Geheimnis ruhe bei Brahms.
An die U.-E. (Br.): fordere die Ausgabe zum versprochenen Termin: 15. IV. This entry refers to Johannes Brahms: Oktaven und Quinten u. a., ed. Heinrich Schenker (Vienna: Universal Edition, 1933).
Nach der Jause übergebe ich Dr. Neumann die Zahnprothese zur Reparatur.
Auf der letzten Stufe dieses Hauses stolpere ich – Gott sei Dank ohne Folgen – früh zu Bett.
Furtwängler (to the minister) To Weisse (letter, six pages): clarification of the misunderstanding – a matter of humus, but improved humus ought to be welcomed.
To Mrs. Komorn (visiting card): the secret lies with Brahms.
To UE (letter): I insist that the edition appears by the agreed deadline of April 15.
After teatime, I give Dr. Neumann my false tooth for repair.
On the last step of his house, I trip – without consequences, thank God; early to bed.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April 12, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Den freien Satz wieder aufgenommen u. wieder – endlich – um einige Blätter vorgerückt.

An Rinn (Br.): über meine Anfrage wegen des Kalbeck-Briefes Schenker had written to Wilhelm Altmann on March 19 about a letter from Brahms to his biographer Max Kalbeck. In his reply, Altmann said that he knew nothing about the letter; see the diary entries of March 19 and 23, 1933. – sage den Haydn-Aufsatz für September zu File 49 in the Oster Collection contains extensive materials for an unfinished article on Haydn, apparently from the 1930s. – Dr. Klein wird den Aufsatz bringen.
Nach Tisch zur Bank wegen der Coupons.
Wege.
Dr. Baumgarten zum Thee: 6–½9h.
Free Composition taken up again, and once more – finally – advanced by a few pages.
To Rinn (letter): concerning my query about the letter to Kalbeck – I agree to write the article on Haydn by September – Dr. Klein will publish the article.
After lunch, to the bank on account of the coupons.
Errands.
Dr. Baumgarten for tea: 6 o’clock to 8:30.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April 13, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Abzüge von Dr. Rinn. This entry refers to Heinrich Schenker, Erinnerungen an Brahms, Deutsche Zeitschrift, 46. Jahrgang des Kunstwarts, Heft 8 (May 1933), pp. 475–82.
Frl. Elias bringt schöne rote Rosen!
Bei Dr. Neumann (S. 40).
Korrektur durchgesehen. This entry refers to Heinrich Schenker, Erinnerungen an Brahms, Deutsche Zeitschrift, 46. Jahrgang des Kunstwarts, Heft 8 (May 1933), pp. 475–82.
Mit Lie-Liechen Blätter zum freien Satz gelesen.
Printouts from Dr. Rinn.
Miss Elias brings beautiful red roses!
At Dr. Neumann’s (40 shillings).
Proofs examined.
With Lie-Liechen, pages for Free Composition read aloud.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April 14, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Korrektur fertig, verpackt. This entry refers to Heinrich Schenker, Erinnerungen an Brahms, Deutsche Zeitschrift, 46. Jahrgang des Kunstwarts, Heft 8 (May 1933), pp. 475–482.
Von U.-E. (Drucksache): die Titelvignette.
An die U.-E. (Drucksache): die Titelvignette mit imprimatur zurück. These entries refer to Johannes Brahms: Oktaven und Quinten u. a., ed. Heinrich Schenker (Vienna: Universal Edition, 1933).
Von Frau Rothberger (Br.): wegen eines Mädchens usw.
Von Dr. Baumgarten (Br.): bittet um S. 400.
Telephonire eine Absage an ihn, nenne die wirkliche Höhe meines Einkommens.
Von Wilfort (Br. durch Botin): fragt, ob ich heute empfange?!? antworte: „ja“ – schreibt „sehr geehrter Herr Doktor“ – nichts von Verehrung oder Dank.

Nach der Jause befördert Lie-Liechen zur Post: Korrektur an Rinn, rec., S. 9.20 für das Telephon u. imprimatur
an die U.-E..
Für einen neuen Ueberzug zur Coupétasche ( S. 39.50.
Wege.
Proof corrections finished, packed.
From UE (printed papers): the title-page.
To UE (printed papers): the title vignette returned, with authorization to publish.
From Mrs. Rothberger (letter): concerning a maid, etc.
From Dr. Baumgarten (letter): requests 400 shillings.
I telephone a refusal to him, stating the actual extent of my income.
From Wilfort (letter, sent by messenger): asks whether I would receive visitors today?!? I reply, "Yes." – He writes "Very dear Dr.," nothing about reverence or gratitude.
After teatime, Lie-Liechen brings to the post office: the proof corrections to Rinn, by registered mail; 9.20 shillings for the telephone; and, to UE, the authorization to publish.
For a new cover for the documents case, 39.50 shillings.
Errands.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April 15, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Am freien Satz.
Von der U.-E. (K.): Brahms wird eine Woche nach Ostern erscheinen. Johannes Brahms: Oktaven und Quinten u. a., ed. Heinrich Schenker (Vienna: Universal Edition, 1933).
Nach der Jause: Bestellung eines Friseurs ins Haus.
Nach dem Abendessen: Fortsetzung der Lese – Lie-Liechen schreibt.
Work on Free Composition.
From UE (postcard): Brahms will be published a week after Easter.
After teatime, we order a hairdresser to come to us.
After supper, continuation of the reading – Lie-Liechen writes.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April 16, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Das Abendessen (!?) im Café Aspang, seit Monaten zum ersten Mal außer Haus! Auch der „Simplizissimus“ zeigt seine „Umstellung“ Umstellung: a reference to the enforced political and ideological conformity in Germany, known officially as Gleichschaltung, which came into effect almost from the start of the Nazi regime. an.
Supper (!?) at the Café Aspang: away from home for the first time in months! Even Simplizissimus shows signs of "reorientation."

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April 17, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Frl. Violin von 11–12h; erkundigt sich nach uns; Floriz will u. muss (?) zurück, sucht Geld für die Uebersiedlung.
Mittags bei Hartmann gegessen – schlecht!
Miss Violin from 11 to 12 o’clock; she asks how we are; Floriz wants to, and must (?), return, he is looking for money for the relocation.
Lunch at Hartmann’s – bad!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April 18, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Sophie (Br.): schwere Augenerkrankung des Schwagers, Kinder u. Schwiegersohn helfen! Wären wir einer solchen Hilfe sicher, wie schön flöße uns das Leben dahin, der Arbeit in Schwung zugewandt!
Nach der Jause Wege.
Rf.: Brahms-Konzert, Kraus, Lehmann, Philharmoniker!

From Sophie (letter): severe eye ailment of the brother-in-law – the children and son-in-law are helping! If we were sure of such help, how beautifully would our lives flow, in devotion to the work in hand!
After teatime, errands.
Radio: Brahms concert, Kraus, Lehmann, Vienna Philharmonic!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April 19, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Nach der Jause bestellen wir eine kleine Strickblouse bei Squarenina.
Telephonische Verabredung mit Frau Rothberger für Sonntag 5h.
After teatime we order a small knitted blouse from Squarenina.
Date arranged by telephone with Mrs. Rothberger for Sunday at 5 o’clock.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April 20, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Floriz (Br.): kehrt Anfangs Juli nach Wien zurück, vielleicht mit zwei Schülern auch für mich!
Frage telephonisch Dr. Heinsheimer: wo bleibt die Brahms-Studie? Johannes Brahms: Oktaven und Quinten u. a., ed. Heinrich Schenker (Vienna: Universal Edition, 1933).
Nach Tisch zur Mercurbank u. Wege.
Von der U.-E.: zehn Exemplare! Johannes Brahms: Oktaven und Quinten u. a., ed. Heinrich Schenker (Vienna: Universal Edition, 1933).
Lie-Liechen verpackt für Rinn u. für die Schwester Rosa.
From Floriz (letter): he is returning to Vienna at the beginning of July, perhaps even with two pupils for me!
I ask Dr. Heinsheimer over the telephone: what has happened to the Brahms study?
After lunch, to the Mercurbank, and errands.
From UE: ten copies!
Lie-Liechen packs copies for Rinn, and for her sister Rosa.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April 21, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: An die U.-E. (Br.): 12 Adressen.

An die Gesellschaft der Musikfreunde (Br.GdM Briefe HS, [3]): Ankündigung der zwei Belegexemplare u. Dank. These entries refer to Johannes Brahms: Oktaven und Quinten u. a., ed. Heinrich Schenker (Vienna: Universal Edition, 1933).
An Floriz (Br.OJ 6/8, [22]): freue mich des Glückes im Unglück – den Schülern nicht bange machen!
To UE (letter): twelve addresses.
To the Society of the Friends of Music (letterGdM Briefe HS, [3]): announcement of two complimentary copies, and thanks.
To Floriz (letterOJ 6/8, [22]): I am glad of his luck in such circumstances – do not frighten the pupils!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April 22, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Die Rate von Mozio.

„Tag der Musikpflege“ im Palais Kinsky. Bamberger in Mozarts Divertimento unvergleichlich; stoße mit dieser Wertung bei den Leuten auf Widerstand: „wirklich“? On April 22–23, 1933, the Tag der Musikpflege, encouraged by the conductor Friedrich Dürauer and organized by the music critic Robert Konta, was celebrated at events throughout Austria in which musicians offered their services free of charge. In the capital, concerts were given by the Vienna Philharmonic, singers from the State Opera, and several chamber music societies. At the Opera, free ballet performances were offered to children from poor families (see Paul Stefan, "Ein ‘Tag der Musikpflege’ in Wien," Musikblätter des Anbruch 15, vol. 4/5 (1933), p. 68). At the Palais Kinsky, Carl Bamberger conducted a Bach Brandenburg concerto and a cantata, a harpsichord concerto by Haydn, and a Divertimento in D major by Mozart (probably K. 334, on account of its famous Minuet, which is mentioned by the reviewer: see "Kleine Chronik. Kammerkonzert im Palais Kinsky," Neue freie Presse, No. 24648, April 26, 1933, evening edition, p. 2).
The installment from Mozio.
"Day of Music-Making" at the Palais Kinsky. Bamberger incomparable in Mozart’s Divertimento; in making this judgment, I encounter opposition from people in the audience: "Really?"

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April 23, 1933

tei:ab.tei:seg: Sagen Frau Rothberger ab.
Nach der Jause: Schleife: Schwarzenbergplatz – Gürtel.
Lese Blätter zum freien Satz vor.
We cancel Mrs. Rothberger.
After teatime, a stroll to the Schwarzenbergplatz – Gürtel.
I read aloud pages for Free Composition.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April 24, 1933

sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Postweg: Brahms Johannes Brahms: Oktaven und Quinten u. a., ed. Heinrich Schenker (Vienna: Universal Edition, 1933). für Hoboken, Rinn, Rosl.

An v. Hoboken (Br.OJ 89/6, [5]): gebe meiner Erläuterung Erläuterung: Schenker’s commentary in the facsimile edition Johannes Brahms: Oktaven und Quinten u. a. Wert, damit sie den Cynismus u. die S. 1300 überwinde, erwähne dagegen der „Erinnerungen“ in einem leichteren Tone. Zupfe Bambergers Leistung an usw.

An Deutsch (Br.): Dank; vom Abend im Kinsky-Palais. On the evening of April 22, Carl Bamberger conducted a Divertimento in D major by Mozart (probably 334) at the Palais Kinsky as part of the Tag der Musikpflege. Schenker, who attended the concert, found Bamberger’s conducting "incomparable". See the diary entry for April 22, 1933, and the article Kleine Chronik. Kammerkonzert im Palais Kinsky in the Neue freie Presse (No. 24648, April 26, 1933, evening edition, p. 2).
Von Herrn Ausländer (Br. aus New YorkOC 18/30): Dank; will Partieen in Musik-Magazinen veröffentlichen!
Lie-Liechen verpackt Brahms Johannes Brahms: Oktaven und Quinten u. a., ed. Heinrich Schenker (Vienna: Universal Edition, 1933). an Furtwängler, Oppel, Vrieslander; schreibt zum freien Satz.
Trip to the post office: Brahms for Hoboken, Rinn, Rosl.

To Hoboken (letterOJ 89/6, [5]): I clarify for him the value of my explanation, so that it will overcome his cynicism and the 1,300 shillings; on the other hand, I mention the "Recollections" in a gentler tone. I hint at Bamberger’s achievement, etc.
To Deutsch (letter): thanks; concerning the evening at the Palais Kinsky.
From Mr. Auslander (letter from New YorkOC 18/30): thanks; he wants to publish extracts in music magazines!
Lie-Liechen packs Brahms for Furtwängler, Oppel, Vrieslander; she writes up portions of Free Composition.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April 25, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Rosl (Br.): Schicksal der armen Frieda u. der Kinder; Klara besser!
Bamberger von 11–12h: hat HändelConcerto grosso in a-Moll, op. 6, No. 4 (HWV 322) in Kiew mit Erfolg aufgeführt – ist hier ohne jede Beschäftigung.
Von der U.-E.: die elf Glanz-Copien der Brahms-Studie als Geschenk.
Nach der Jause zur Post; Brahms Johannes Brahms: Oktaven und Quinten u. a., ed. Heinrich Schenker (Vienna: Universal Edition, 1933). für Furtwängler, Oppel, Vrieslander.

Die arme Lie-Lie ist an der Klexerei ganz unschuldig!!! This entry presumably refers to the ink blots found on this page of the diary. (It probably originates with her, as she refers to herself as "Lie-Lie," not the usual "Lie-Liechen.")
Ein Rasiermesser gekauft!
Wieder einmal eine Patiençe in 2 Legen!
Lie-Liechen macht eine weiße Wollmütze wieder tragbar – ein Wunder!
From Rosl (letter): the fate of poor Frieda and her children; Klara is better!
Bamberger from 11 to 12 o’clock: he has performed HandelConcerto grosso in A minor, Op. 6, No. 4 (HWV 322) in Kiev with success – he is here without any employment.
From UE: the eleven luxury copies of the Brahms study, as a gift.
After teatime, to the post office; Brahms for Furtwängler, Oppel, Vrieslander.
Poor Lie-Lie is completely innocent of the spillage!!!
A razor purchased!
Once more, a game of solitaire completed in two rounds!
Lie-Liechen makes a white wollen cap fit to be worn again – a miracle!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April 26, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: An Frieda (K.): was ist’s?
An Rinn (K.): Brahms‘ Briefe sind bei Kalbecks Tochter.
Fortsetzung: „Nebennote“ für Der freie Satz.
Von Deutsch (K.OJ 10/3, [189]): v. H. sei verheiratet; habe die Brahms-Studie schon im Schaufenster gesehen; will mich besuchen.
Lie-Liechen bestellt Frühmann für morgen 11h.

Nach
der Jause holen wir bei Squarenina die bestellte Blouse ab.
An die DAZ S. 29.07 abgeschickt.
Seligmann schreibt in der N. Fr. Presse sehr hübsch über Bambergers Konzert. Kleine Chronik. Kammerkonzert im Palais Kinsky, Neue freie Presse, No. 24648, April 26, 1933, evening edition, p. 2.
To Frieda (postcard): what is the matter?
To Rinn (postcard): Brahms’s letters are with Kalbeck’s daughter.
Continuation: "Neighboring Tone" for Free Composition.
From Deutsch (postcardOJ 10/3, [189]): Hoboken has married; he has already seen the Brahms study in the shop windows; he would like to visit me.
Lie-Liechen asks Frühmann to come tomorrow at 11 o’clock.

After
teatime, we collect the blouse ordered from Squarenina.
To the DAZ, 29.07 shillings sent off.
Seligmann writes very nicely in the Neue freie Presse about Bamberger’s concert.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April 27, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Weil (Br.): Dank für Brahms. Johannes Brahms: Oktaven und Quinten u. a., ed. Heinrich Schenker (Vienna: Universal Edition, 1933).
An Vrieslander (Br.): zur Studie; über Bamberger; über meinen Brief an Weisse in der Liederangelegenheit.
Frühmann findet Lie-Liechen u. mich in Ordnung – Gott sei Dank!

Von der U.-E. (K.): die Brahms-Studie wird in der Brahms-Nummer der Fachzeitschrift für Musikverleger Either Musikalienhandel. Zeitschrift und Anzeigenblatt der Reichsmusikkammer, Fachschaft Musikverleger (Leipzig), or Österreichische Autorenzeitung. Offizielles Organ der österreichischen Autoren, Komponisten und Musikverleger (Vienna). angezeigt werden (!?!).
Nach der Jause im Verkehrsbüro: Prospekte.
Bei Guttmann im Schaufenster die Brahms-Studie als „Neuerscheinung“ – von wem?
From Weil (letter): thanks for Brahms.
To Vrieslander (letter): about the study; about Bamberger; about my letter to Weisse in the matter concerning his songs.
Frühmann finds Lie-Liechen and me in good shape – thank God!
From UE (postcard): the Brahms study will be advertised in the Brahms issue of the specialist periodical for music publishers (!?!).
After teatime, at the tourist agency: prospectuses.
In the shop window at Guttmann’s, the Brahms study as a "new publication" – by whom?

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April 28, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: An Oppel (Br.): zur Brahms-Studie; mache auf den Kunstwart aufmerksam.
Die DAZ bringt den Aufsatz!!!
An Floriz (K.OJ 8/5, [17]): mach auf den Aufsatz aufmerksam!
An die U.-E. (K.): erbitte Exemplare an Martin u. Reigersberg.
Nach der Jause gemeinsamer Postweg.
Wieder einmal eine Patiençe in zwei Legen.
Während des Mittagmahles das erste Gewitter!!
Im Rf.: Violin-Konzert von Bach u. Violin-Konzert von Mozart.
To Oppel (letter): about the Brahms study; I draw his attention to the article in Der Kunstwart.
The DAZ publishes my article!!!
To Floriz (postcardOJ 8/5, [17]): I draw his attention to my article!
To UE (postcard): request that they send copies to Martin and Reigersberg.
After teatime, a trip to the post office together.
Once again, a game of solitaire completed in two rounds.
During lunch, the first thunderstorm!!
On the radio: violin concertos by Bach and Mozart violin concerto.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April 29, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von der U.-E. (Br.): Rechnung: S. 1168.37.
Nach der Jause Wege.

Von Vrieslander (Br.): Dank für Brahms; Johannes Brahms: Oktaven und Quinten u. a., ed. Heinrich Schenker (Vienna: Universal Edition, 1933).möchte darüber schreiben, aber wo?; urteilt über Deutschland scharf, aber gerecht! Spielt Trios!!! Der Glückliche!
Primeln im Haus!

From Oppel (letter): thanks for Brahms; concerning a book by Güldenstein, in which the author takes issue with me; concerning an excellent analysis by one of his pupils, made according to my principles.
From UE (letter): invoice, 1,168.37 shillings.
After teatime, errands.
From Vrieslander (letter): thanks for Brahms; he would like to write about it, but where? He is sharply critical of Germany, but rightly so! Is playing trios!!! The lucky man!
Primroses blossom in our home!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April 30, 1933

tei:ab.tei:seg: Nach der Jause im botanischen Garten auf einer Bank – Schwalben!
Lie-Liechen schreibt drei Karten nach Mönichkirchen.
After teatime, in the Botanical Garden, on a bench – swallows!
Lie-Liechen writes three postcards to Mönichkirchen.
